pokemon.desc: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
pokemon.name: Bulbasaur

pokemon.desc: When the bulb on its back grows large, it appears to lose the ability to stand on its hind legs.
pokemon.name: Ivysaur

pokemon.desc: Its plant blooms when it is absorbing solar energy. It stays on the move to seek sunlight.
pokemon.name: Venusaur

pokemon.desc: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
pokemon.name: Charmander

pokemon.desc: It has a barbaric nature. In battle, it whips its fiery tail around and slashes away with sharp claws.
pokemon.name: Charmeleon

pokemon.desc: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
pokemon.name: Charizard

pokemon.desc: When it retracts its long neck into its shell, it squirts out water with vigorous force.
pokemon.name: Squirtle

pokemon.desc: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that Wartortle is very old.
pokemon.name: Wartortle

pokemon.desc: It crushes its foe under its heavy body to cause fainting. In a pinch, it will withdraw inside its shell.
pokemon.name: Blastoise

pokemon.desc: For protection, it releases a horrible stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.
pokemon.name: Caterpie

pokemon.desc: It is waiting for the moment to evolve. At this stage, it can only harden, so it remains motionless to avoid attack.
pokemon.name: Metapod

pokemon.desc: In battle, it flaps its wings at great speed to release highly toxic dust into the air.
pokemon.name: Butterfree

pokemon.desc: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
pokemon.name: Weedle

pokemon.desc: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
pokemon.name: Kakuna

pokemon.desc: It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
pokemon.name: Beedrill

pokemon.desc: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
pokemon.name: Pidgey

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
pokemon.name: Pidgeotto

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
pokemon.name: Pidgeot

pokemon.desc: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
pokemon.name: Rattata

pokemon.desc: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
pokemon.name: Raticate

pokemon.desc: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
pokemon.name: Spearow

pokemon.desc: A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.
pokemon.name: Fearow

pokemon.desc: The older it gets, the longer it grows. At night, it wraps its long body around tree branches to rest.
pokemon.name: Ekans

pokemon.desc: The frightening patterns on its belly have been studied. Six variations have been confirmed.
pokemon.name: Arbok

pokemon.desc: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.
pokemon.name: Pikachu

pokemon.desc: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
pokemon.name: Raichu

pokemon.desc: It loves to bathe in the grit of dry, sandy areas. By sand bathing, the Pokémon rids itself of dirt and moisture clinging to its body.
pokemon.name: Sandshrew

pokemon.desc: The drier the area Sandslash lives in, the harder and smoother the Pokémon’s spikes will feel when touched.
pokemon.name: Sandslash

pokemon.desc: Females are more sensitive to smells than males. While foraging, they’ll use their whiskers to check wind direction and stay downwind of predators.
pokemon.name: Nidoran-F

pokemon.desc: The horn on its head has atrophied. It’s thought that this happens so Nidorina’s children won’t get poked while their mother is feeding them.
pokemon.name: Nidorina

pokemon.desc: Nidoqueen is better at defense than offense. With scales like armor, this Pokémon will shield its children from any kind of attack.
pokemon.name: Nidoqueen

pokemon.desc: The horn on a male Nidoran’s forehead contains a powerful poison. This is a very cautious Pokémon, always straining its large ears.
pokemon.name: Nidoran-M

pokemon.desc: With a horn that’s harder than diamond, this Pokémon goes around shattering boulders as it searches for a moon stone.
pokemon.name: Nidorino

pokemon.desc: When it goes on a rampage, it’s impossible to control. But in the presence of a Nidoqueen it’s lived with for a long time, Nidoking calms down.
pokemon.name: Nidoking

pokemon.desc: It is said that happiness will come to those who see a gathering of Clefairy dancing under a full moon.
pokemon.name: Clefairy

pokemon.desc: A timid fairy Pokémon that is rarely seen, it will run and hide the moment it senses people.
pokemon.name: Clefable

pokemon.desc: While young, it has six gorgeous tails. When it grows, several new tails are sprouted.
pokemon.name: Vulpix

pokemon.desc: It is said to live 1,000 years, and each of its tails is loaded with supernatural powers.
pokemon.name: Ninetales

pokemon.desc: Jigglypuff has top-notch lung capacity, even by comparison to other Pokémon. It won’t stop singing its lullabies until its foes fall asleep.
pokemon.name: Jigglypuff

pokemon.desc: The more air it takes in, the more it inflates. If opponents catch it in a bad mood, it will inflate itself to an enormous size to intimidate them.
pokemon.name: Wigglytuff

pokemon.desc: It emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its surroundings. Even in tight caves, Zubat flies around with skill.
pokemon.name: Zubat

pokemon.desc: It loves to drink other creatures’ blood. It’s said that if it finds others of its kind going hungry, it sometimes shares the blood it’s gathered.
pokemon.name: Golbat

pokemon.desc: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.
pokemon.name: Oddish

pokemon.desc: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.
pokemon.name: Gloom

pokemon.desc: It has the world’s largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.
pokemon.name: Vileplume

pokemon.desc: Burrows under the ground to gnaw on tree roots. The mushrooms on its back absorb most of the nutrition.
pokemon.name: Paras

pokemon.desc: The bug host is drained of energy by the mushroom on its back. The mushroom appears to do all the thinking.
pokemon.name: Parasect

pokemon.desc: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
pokemon.name: Venonat

pokemon.desc: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
pokemon.name: Venomoth

pokemon.desc: If a Diglett digs through a field, it leaves the soil perfectly tilled and ideal for planting crops.
pokemon.name: Diglett

pokemon.desc: A team of Diglett triplets. It triggers huge earthquakes by burrowing 60 miles underground.
pokemon.name: Dugtrio

pokemon.desc: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
pokemon.name: Meowth

pokemon.desc: Getting this prideful Pokémon to warm up to you takes a lot of effort, and it will claw at you the moment it gets annoyed.
pokemon.name: Persian

pokemon.desc: Psyduck is constantly beset by headaches. If the Pokémon lets its strange power erupt, apparently the pain subsides for a while.
pokemon.name: Psyduck

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon lives in gently flowing rivers. It paddles through the water with its long limbs, putting its graceful swimming skills on display.
pokemon.name: Golduck

pokemon.desc: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
pokemon.name: Mankey

pokemon.desc: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
pokemon.name: Primeape

pokemon.desc: It has a brave and trustworthy nature. It fearlessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.
pokemon.name: Growlithe

pokemon.desc: The sight of it running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night has captivated many people.
pokemon.name: Arcanine

pokemon.desc: For Poliwag, swimming is easier than walking. The swirl pattern on its belly is actually part of the Pokémon’s innards showing through the skin.
pokemon.name: Poliwag

pokemon.desc: Staring at the swirl on its belly causes drowsiness. This trait of Poliwhirl’s has been used in place of lullabies to get children to go to sleep.
pokemon.name: Poliwhirl

pokemon.desc: Its body is solid muscle. When swimming through cold seas, Poliwrath uses its impressive arms to smash through drift ice and plow forward.
pokemon.name: Poliwrath

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon uses its psychic powers while it sleeps. The contents of Abra’s dreams affect the powers that the Pokémon wields.
pokemon.name: Abra

pokemon.desc: Using its psychic power, Kadabra levitates as it sleeps. It uses its springy tail as a pillow.
pokemon.name: Kadabra

pokemon.desc: It has an incredibly high level of intelligence. Some say that Alakazam remembers everything that ever happens to it, from birth till death.
pokemon.name: Alakazam

pokemon.desc: Its whole body is composed of muscles. Even though it’s the size of a human child, it can hurl 100 grown-ups.
pokemon.name: Machop

pokemon.desc: Its muscular body is so powerful, it must wear a power-save belt to be able to regulate its motions.
pokemon.name: Machoke

pokemon.desc: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
pokemon.name: Machamp

pokemon.desc: Prefers hot and humid places. It ensnares tiny bugs with its vines and devours them.
pokemon.name: Bellsprout

pokemon.desc: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
pokemon.name: Weepinbell

pokemon.desc: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
pokemon.name: Victreebel

pokemon.desc: Tentacool is not a particularly strong swimmer. It drifts across the surface of shallow seas as it searches for prey.
pokemon.name: Tentacool

pokemon.desc: When the red orbs on Tentacruel’s head glow brightly, watch out. The Pokémon is about to fire off a burst of ultrasonic waves.
pokemon.name: Tentacruel

pokemon.desc: Commonly found near mountain trails and the like. If you step on one by accident, it gets angry.
pokemon.name: Geodude

pokemon.desc: Often seen rolling down mountain trails. Obstacles are just things to roll straight over, not avoid.
pokemon.name: Graveler

pokemon.desc: Once it sheds its skin, its body turns tender and whitish. Its hide hardens when it’s exposed to air.
pokemon.name: Golem

pokemon.desc: It can’t run properly when it’s newly born. As it races around with others of its kind, its legs grow stronger.
pokemon.name: Ponyta

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon can be seen galloping through fields at speeds of up to 150 mph, its fiery mane fluttering in the wind.
pokemon.name: Rapidash

pokemon.desc: Slow-witted and oblivious, this Pokémon won’t feel any pain if its tail gets eaten. It won’t notice when its tail grows back, either.
pokemon.name: Slowpoke

pokemon.desc: Slowpoke became Slowbro when a Shellder bit on to its tail. Sweet flavors seeping from the tail make the Shellder feel as if its life is a dream.
pokemon.name: Slowbro

pokemon.desc: At times, Magnemite runs out of electricity and ends up on the ground. If you give batteries to a grounded Magnemite, it’ll start moving again.
pokemon.name: Magnemite

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon is three Magnemite that have linked together. Magneton sends out powerful radio waves to study its surroundings.
pokemon.name: Magneton

pokemon.desc: The stalk this Pokémon carries in its wings serves as a sword to cut down opponents. In a dire situation, the stalk can also serve as food.
pokemon.name: Farfetch'd

pokemon.desc: Its short wings make flying difficult. Instead, this Pokémon runs at high speed on developed legs.
pokemon.name: Doduo

pokemon.desc: One of Doduo’s two heads splits to form a unique species. It runs close to 40 mph in prairies.
pokemon.name: Dodrio

pokemon.desc: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon.name: Seel

pokemon.desc: Its entire body is a snowy white. Unharmed by even intense cold, it swims powerfully in icy waters.
pokemon.name: Dewgong

pokemon.desc: Made of congealed sludge. It smells too putrid to touch. Even weeds won’t grow in its path.
pokemon.name: Grimer

pokemon.desc: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
pokemon.name: Muk

pokemon.desc: It swims facing backward by opening and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.
pokemon.name: Shellder

pokemon.desc: Its shell is extremely hard. It cannot be shattered, even with a bomb. The shell opens only when it is attacking.
pokemon.name: Cloyster

pokemon.desc: Born from gases, anyone would faint if engulfed by its gaseous body, which contains poison.
pokemon.name: Gastly

pokemon.desc: Its tongue is made of gas. If licked, its victim starts shaking constantly until death eventually comes.
pokemon.name: Haunter

pokemon.desc: On the night of a full moon, if shadows move on their own and laugh, it must be Gengar’s doing.
pokemon.name: Gengar

pokemon.desc: As it digs through the ground, it absorbs many hard objects. This is what makes its body so solid.
pokemon.name: Onix

pokemon.desc: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
pokemon.name: Drowzee

pokemon.desc: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
pokemon.name: Hypno

pokemon.desc: It can be found near the sea. The large pincers grow back if they are torn out of their sockets.
pokemon.name: Krabby

pokemon.desc: Its large and hard pincer has 10,000-horsepower strength. However, being so big, it is unwieldy to move.
pokemon.name: Kingler

pokemon.desc: It is said to camouflage itself as a Poké Ball. It will self-destruct with very little stimulus.
pokemon.name: Voltorb

pokemon.desc: Stores electrical energy inside its body. Even the slightest shock could trigger a huge explosion.
pokemon.name: Electrode

pokemon.desc: Though it may look like it’s just a bunch of eggs, it’s a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.
pokemon.name: Exeggcute

pokemon.desc: Each of Exeggutor’s three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don’t seem to be very interested in one another.
pokemon.name: Exeggutor

pokemon.desc: When the memory of its departed mother brings it to tears, its cries echo mournfully within the skull it wears on its head.
pokemon.name: Cubone

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon overcame its sorrow to evolve a sturdy new body. Marowak faces its opponents bravely, using a bone as a weapon.
pokemon.name: Marowak

pokemon.desc: This amazing Pokémon has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.
pokemon.name: Hitmonlee

pokemon.desc: Its punches slice the air. They are launched at such high speed, even a slight graze could cause a burn.
pokemon.name: Hitmonchan

pokemon.desc: If this Pokémon’s sticky saliva gets on you and you don’t clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won’t go away, either.
pokemon.name: Lickitung

pokemon.desc: Its body is full of poisonous gas. It floats into garbage dumps, seeking out the fumes of raw, rotting trash.
pokemon.name: Koffing

pokemon.desc: It mixes gases between its two bodies. It’s said that these Pokémon were seen all over the Galar region back in the day.
pokemon.name: Weezing

pokemon.desc: Strong, but not too bright, this Pokémon can shatter even a skyscraper with its charging tackles.
pokemon.name: Rhyhorn

pokemon.desc: It begins walking on its hind legs after evolution. It can punch holes through boulders with its horn.
pokemon.name: Rhydon

pokemon.desc: The egg Chansey carries is not only delicious but also packed with nutrition. It’s used as a high-class cooking ingredient.
pokemon.name: Chansey

pokemon.desc: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon’s true appearance remains a mystery.
pokemon.name: Tangela

pokemon.desc: Although it’s carrying its baby in a pouch on its belly, Kangaskhan is swift on its feet. It intimidates its opponents with quick jabs.
pokemon.name: Kangaskhan

pokemon.desc: Horsea makes its home in oceans with gentle currents. If this Pokémon is under attack, it spits out pitch-black ink and escapes.
pokemon.name: Horsea

pokemon.desc: It’s the males that raise the offspring. While Seadra are raising young, the spines on their backs secrete thicker and stronger poison.
pokemon.name: Seadra

pokemon.desc: Its dorsal, pectoral, and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the Water Dancer.
pokemon.name: Goldeen

pokemon.desc: In autumn, its body becomes more fatty in preparing to propose to a mate. It takes on beautiful colors.
pokemon.name: Seaking

pokemon.desc: If you visit a beach at the end of summer, you’ll be able to see groups of Staryu lighting up in a steady rhythm.
pokemon.name: Staryu

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon has an organ known as its core. The organ glows in seven colors when Starmie is unleashing its potent psychic powers.
pokemon.name: Starmie

pokemon.desc: The broadness of its hands may be no coincidence—many scientists believe its palms became enlarged specifically for pantomiming.
pokemon.name: Mr. Mime

pokemon.desc: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.
pokemon.name: Scyther

pokemon.desc: In certain parts of Galar, Jynx was once feared and worshiped as the Queen of Ice.
pokemon.name: Jynx

pokemon.desc: Many power plants keep Ground-type Pokémon around as a defense against Electabuzz that come seeking electricity.
pokemon.name: Electabuzz

pokemon.desc: Magmar dispatches its prey with fire. But it regrets this habit once it realizes that it has burned its intended prey to a charred crisp.
pokemon.name: Magmar

pokemon.desc: These Pokémon judge one another based on pincers. Thicker, more impressive pincers make for more popularity with the opposite gender.
pokemon.name: Pinsir

pokemon.desc: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it’s a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.
pokemon.name: Tauros

pokemon.desc: It is virtually worthless in terms of both power and speed. It is the most weak and pathetic Pokémon in the world.
pokemon.name: Magikarp

pokemon.desc: It has an extremely aggressive nature. The Hyper Beam it shoots from its mouth totally incinerates all targets.
pokemon.name: Gyarados

pokemon.desc: A smart and kindhearted Pokémon, it glides across the surface of the sea while its beautiful song echoes around it.
pokemon.name: Lapras

pokemon.desc: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.
pokemon.name: Ditto

pokemon.desc: It has the ability to alter the composition of its body to suit its surrounding environment.
pokemon.name: Eevee

pokemon.desc: When Vaporeon’s fins begin to vibrate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.
pokemon.name: Vaporeon

pokemon.desc: If it is angered or startled, the fur all over its body bristles like sharp needles that pierce foes.
pokemon.name: Jolteon

pokemon.desc: Once it has stored up enough heat, this Pokémon’s body temperature can reach up to 1,700 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokemon.name: Flareon

pokemon.desc: State-of-the-art technology was used to create Porygon. It was the first artificial Pokémon to be created via computer programming.
pokemon.name: Porygon

pokemon.desc: Because some Omanyte manage to escape after being restored or are released into the wild by people, this species is becoming a problem.
pokemon.name: Omanyte

pokemon.desc: Weighed down by a large and heavy shell, Omastar couldn’t move very fast. Some say it went extinct because it was unable to catch food.
pokemon.name: Omastar

pokemon.desc: This species is almost entirely extinct. Kabuto molt every three days, making their shells harder and harder.
pokemon.name: Kabuto

pokemon.desc: Kabutops slices its prey apart and sucks out the fluids. The discarded body parts become food for other Pokémon.
pokemon.name: Kabutops

pokemon.desc: This is a ferocious Pokémon from ancient times. Apparently even modern technology is incapable of producing a perfectly restored specimen.
pokemon.name: Aerodactyl

pokemon.desc: It is not satisfied unless it eats over 880 pounds of food every day. When it is done eating, it goes promptly to sleep.
pokemon.name: Snorlax

pokemon.desc: It’s said that this Pokémon’s beautiful blue wings are made of ice. Articuno flies over snowy mountains, its long tail fluttering along behind it.
pokemon.name: Articuno

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon has complete control over electricity. There are tales of Zapdos nesting in the dark depths of pitch-black thunderclouds.
pokemon.name: Zapdos

pokemon.desc: It’s one of the legendary bird Pokémon. When Moltres flaps its flaming wings, they glimmer with a dazzling red glow.
pokemon.name: Moltres

pokemon.desc: Dratini dwells near bodies of rapidly flowing water, such as the plunge pools of waterfalls. As it grows, Dratini will shed its skin many times.
pokemon.name: Dratini

pokemon.desc: This Pokémon lives in pristine oceans and lakes. It can control the weather, and it uses this power to fly into the sky, riding on the wind.
pokemon.name: Dragonair

pokemon.desc: It’s a kindhearted Pokémon. If it spots a drowning person or Pokémon, Dragonite simply must help them.
pokemon.name: Dragonite

pokemon.desc: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
pokemon.name: Mewtwo

pokemon.desc: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
pokemon.name: Mew
